General information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.

References.[1]: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134(200.Reference of the published comparison re: Ratel G., Michotte C., BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{134}$Cs and links for the 1978 international comparison CCRI(II)-K2.Cs-134, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/40/1A/06024}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2003, \textbf{40}, Tech. Suppl., 06024}

Ratel G., Michotte C., W\"{a}tjen U., Janssen H., Sz\ücs L., Coursol N. and Hino Y., Activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{134}$Cs for the IRMM, Geel, PTB, Germany, OMH, Hungary, LNE-LNHB, France and the NMIJ, Japan in the ongoing comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/42/1A/06013}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2005, \textbf{42}, Tech. Suppl., 06013}

Ratel G., Michotte C., Leena J., Iglicki A., Sahagia M., Hino Y., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{134}$Cs to include the 2005 results of the BARC (India) and the CNEA (Argentina), the 2006 result of the IFIN-HH (Romania) and the link for the 2005 regional comparison APMP.RI(II)-K2.Cs-134 to include the VNIIM and the INER, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/44/1A/06004}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2007, \textbf{44}, Tech. Suppl., 06004}

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134(201.Reference of the published comparison re: Michotte C., Ratel G., Courte S., Maringer F.J., Caffari Y. and van Wyngaardt W.M., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{134}$Cs to include the 2008 results of the BEV (Austria), the 2009 result of the IRA (Switzerland) and the 2010 results of the NMISA (South Africa), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/50/1A/06009}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2013, \textbf{50}, Tech. Suppl., 06009}

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134(202.Reference of the published comparison re: Michotte C., Courte S., Coulon R., Nonis M, Judge S., Ratel G., da Silva C.J., Galea R., Moore K., Dziel T., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Cs-134 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{134}$Csto include the 2014 result of the POLATOM (Poland), the 2014 result of the NRC (Canada), the 2015 result of the LNMRI-IRD (Brazil) and the 2016 result of the PTB (Germany), \href{http://dx.doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/60/1A/06005}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2023, \textbf{60}, Tech. Suppl., 06005}

Linked comparison APMP.RI(II)-K2.Cs-134(.Reference of the linked comparison: Hino H., Moune M., Lani\`{e}ce I.A., Yuen M.C., Kharitonov I.A., APMP comparison of the activity measururements of Cs-134, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/45/1A/06001}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2008, \textbf{45}, 1A}

Data from PTB-2016.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): The final result is the weighted mean of the results of four methods. The relative uncertainty (0.25\%) of 4P-PC-MX-NA-GR-CO is adopted for the final results. This is larger than the internal and external relative uncertainties of the weighted mean.
